## Type of Change

Please check the options that are relevant:

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)
- [ ] Documentation update

- [ ] Performance improvement
- [ ] Test coverage improvement

## Code Quality Checklist

- [ ] My code follows the project's coding standards (ES6+, JSDoc)
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings or errors
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix/feature works
- [ ] New and existing tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] Any dependent changes have been merged and published

## Documentation

- [ ] Updated README.md (if applicable)
- [ ] Updated CLAUDE.md (if architecture changed)
- [ ] Added/updated JSDoc comments
- [ ] Updated CONTRIBUTING.md (if development process changed)

## Security Considerations

- [ ] No secrets or sensitive data in code
- [ ] Input validation for user-provided data
- [ ] No introduction of path traversal vulnerabilities
- [ ] No XML injection vulnerabilities
- [ ] Secure file operations

## Performance Impact

Describe any performance implications:
- Expected impact on export time
- Memory usage considerations
- Impact on large collections

## Backwards Compatibility

- [ ] This change is backwards compatible
- [ ] This change includes migration path for breaking changes
- [ ] Documentation includes upgrade notes

## Additional Notes

Any additional information that reviewers should know:
- Known limitations
- Future improvements planned
- Dependencies added/removed

## Review Checklist (for reviewers)

- [ ] Code follows project conventions
- [ ] Changes are well-tested
- [ ] Documentation is clear and complete
- [ ] No security vulnerabilities introduced
- [ ] Performance impact is acceptable
